headline: Spanish Rice II
description: Rice is sauteed with onion and green bell pepper, and then simmered with water, chopped tomatoes and spices.

video.description: This Spanish rice has lots of rich flavor, and is very easy to prepare.
video.name: Spanish Rice II

name: Spanish Rice II
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles
2 teaspoons chili powder, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a deep skillet over medium heat. Saute rice, onion, and bell pepper until rice is browned and onions are tender.
Stir in water and tomatoes. Season with chili powder and salt. Cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, or until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed.

review.reviewBody: We really love this simple rice recipe. Once in a while I use chicken broth instead of water. Everyone who tend it always says how much they like it.
Great taste and very easy to prepare
this is so good and simple - I add cooked chicken or browned seasoned ground beef for a main dish !
Lacked flavor. Maybe instead of using 2 cups water use tomato sauce or half water and 1/2 canned tomatoes.
Did not have enough liquid to cook rice thoroughly , added more tomatoes/ juice
Excellent, just enough bite for us! Easy and will make this again!
Too hot for my family's taste. I did cut back to 1 tsp. chili powder and still found it to be too hot for us. I can see with some adjustments that it could be a recipe my family enjoys

I've used this recipe for several years now. It is great as presented, but, lately I use it as a meatless lunch dish by adding a can of black beans rinsed & a can of corn drained. I also like more tomato so I add in a cup of tomato sauce. For more seasoning I add 2 cloves of minced fresh garlic to the onion, green pepper, rice mixture along with a 1/2 teaspoon of cumin.
It makes 7 servings (a heaping cup each).
Too greasy and not much flavor. Will not make again.

I made this, and it was pretty good. It had a weird smell, so when I brought it into class for a project, nobody wanted to try it. Eventually a few did, and everyone loved it! Make sure to cut the ingredients smaller so there are no chunks. Overall, I recommend!
Omitted bell pepper as husband doesn't like it and this was a perfect addition to our burritos (I grilled the bell pepper on the side for myself)
My husband loved it!

My mom told me about this recipe. We love this but you must make changes. I did 1 1/2 cup of vegetable broth, ( we are vegetarian) and 1, 8oz can of tomato sauce. I sauteed the I onion and bell pepper together removed them added 2 tablespoons of more oil and toasted the rice. I only added 1 teaspoon of chilli powder and 1/2 tsp of cumin and 1/2 teaspoon of crushed peppers 1 can of tomatoes with mild diced chilis drained. sorry this is not all in order but this is the only way to make it the original had way to many problems.

Turned out great! I did make a few changes. Since I didn't have a 10 oz. Can of tomatoes and green chilies I used a 14.5 oz can of diced tomatoes and a 4 oz can of dice green chilies. Then I decreased the water to 1 1/2 cups. Also I was short on time so I skipped sauteing the rice, onions and peppers and put it all in my Insant pot on the rice function. I will definitely make this again. It went great as a side dish to our Sheet Pan Chicken Fajitas, also a great Allrecipies find!
Tuned out great. Love to put two over easy eggs on top and served with tortillas. Terrific breakfast.

I didn't think it had a lot of flavor. I halved the recipe for two of us, and cut back on the chili powder. It tasted mostly like tomatoes. I would change up the spices next time - if I make it again.

As someone mentioned on the carnitas recipe I skimmed the pork broth and used it in place of the water, otherwise followed the direction to a T. My rice was burnt on the bottom (perhaps it should specify to lower the heat) otherwise the top
I had long grain brown rice so I used that instead. I liked the receipe. It was easy to make and the flavours were good. Its a keeper.
We are one the Daniel Fast, and this recipe fits the rules!
I made this for our 2020 New Year's dinner and my family loved it. I will definitely make it again. I substituted chicken broth for water.

Very good! Made a double recipe for a birthday grouping and everyone loved it ... added to a Mexican buffet perfectly! 
thank you!

I didn't have tomatoes of any kind, so I used Knoor's tomato and chicken bullion; two cubes. Also, instead of chilies (since my other two dishes were full of them), I browned, then stirred in a 1/4 pound of chorizo while the rice cooked. It was a big hit with everyone, including me.
Really delicious.. I substituted water with chicken broth.. Will do it again!!

This was simple and yummy AS-IS. My kids and hubby all loved it. Yes, other things can be added, but if you’re reviewing THIS recipe, why rewrite it?? It makes a different recipe. If yours is so much better, submit it. It’s useless to review a recipe if you change the whole thing. Just sayin.
GOOD

I pretty much followed the recipe :), 'cept I used what I had on hand as usual :), 1 yellow pepper/1 Cup diced instead of 1/2 green; added 1/2 tsp cumin; my own canned pint of herbed tomatoes & I added a can of black beans.
purty good. I added jalepeno peppers
I used wild rice and added 1 jalapeño, 1 can sweet corn and it was great! Used it with salad instead of salad dressing.
This was delicious as it was.My family enjoyed it.Made in September
Very good, and easy to prepare.

Oh my goodness was this yummy! I did as another said and sautéed my onions, garlic and fresh garden peppers first before adding the rice to brown. I used chicken bouillon instead of water.
Added my fresh garden tomatoes instead of canned...this is for sure a keeper!

I love Spanish Rice but I always had to buy it in a box. Not anymore! This recipe is awesome and so easy to make plus it has a delightful flavor. I made the recipe as written with no additives nor takeaways. YUM!

So I know, 5 stars and I changed the recipe. But it was so so so good!!! I substituted water for chicken broth. Omitted the onion (yuck). Used the bell pepper but with some minced jalapeño & garlic. But that was it! Same seasonings and method otherwise. Y’all, I will never ever make a different Spanish rice EVER.

I used some garden jalapenos instead of green pepper. Added 1 tbsp of chicken bouillion soup base to the water. Threw in about 1 cup small cherry tomatoes from our garden with the rice, pepper, onion mixture. Husband said to keep the recipe.

I agree with others that it was rather bland, much like the rice you get in a Mexican restaurant. It sorely lacked flavor. It's a good base recipe, but I will be rewriting it to include garlic, broth (chicken or beef) and a 1/2 teaspoon of cumin.
This was really delicious. I used some extra taco seasoning for the chili powder and also added some diced fresh jalapenos. It came out perfect!
It was easy and delicious! I would definitely make it again.

Great as-written; I normally would have taken Jodi's advice (at least with the bacon grease and chicken stock) but the first time I made this, I was serving it to a vegan, and the original recipe worked out just fine. It was more flavorful than I would have expected, judging by the ingredient list. 

El Pato hot tomato sauce is a good alternative to the can of tomatoes and green chilis, if you're serving it to someone who doesn't like the texture of tomato chunks, just fyi (gives it a richer spicy flavor, too).
Good recipe.
I've be trying different recipes for Spanish Rice and I finally found a good one.
I made this and was very happy with the results. Very tasty. I'll make it again when I am in a tex-mex mood.
Wonderful recipe! Came out perfect, thank you for sharing!
Very Delicious! I use a variety of red, green, yellow and orange bell peppers for a beautiful colored dish.
I did add green chilis to the mix and this is the best Spanish rice recipe I have had.
no I didn't change anything I like it just the way its made
This was so simple and amazingly good. Thanks!
Will definitely make again! Made it exactly the way the recipe said to

I added 1 clove of pressed garlic to the onions, pepper and rice when I sauteed them. I also sauteed the rice until brown which is the key to it not turning out mushy. I followed the advice of other reviewers and used chicken stock instead of water; and I used 1 tbl of taco seasoning and 1 tsp of cumin instead of chili powder. It was very good and I would definitely make it again.

OMG, this was SOOOO good. Changes I made: I used real tomatoes cut in small pieces and I used home made chicken stock. This was seriously the most delicious rice I have ever made (and I make rice almost every day)
very good & simple
Really liked it, only change I made was I used garlic salt instead of regular salt. Needed to keep my eyes on it better, if I hadn't caught it it would have burnt >.

I have followed this recipe for years and it is fantastic! Living in South Texas we have a Mexican influence everywhere and this hits it! You can alter this so easily per personal tastes with great outcome! I always add cumin...because.. and use broth vs water. Easily prepared and greatly enjoyed! Thank you for sharing!!!!

I changed the bell peppers to Chipotle peppers and used brown rice instead of white. I also used straight diced tomatoes instead of the tomatoes and green chiles. I substituted the Chile powder for Fajita seasoning to cut the spice a little for our youngest. You have to let it cook a little longer with brown rice. The family ate the whole pot even though i changed it to serve 8 expecting some leftovers.
This was easy and treated really good. I substituted chicken broth instead of water and added garlic in with the rice when sauteed, as well as added cumin with the chili powder.
I added black beans and corn, very good!

Very mushy and wet. I added more spice so it wasn't bland but it was hard to eat since the texture was just so nasty. I let it simmer a little longer too since I could see it was still wet. Also I used less water in the first place.
This recipe turned out very goopy. Also, goopy green bell peppers just don't go well with rice. Just goopy and inedible.
I used Jasmine rice that's The rice I always use and it turned out good! Thanks for the recipe!
I sautéed the rice and onions in bacon grease and used about half cup of pace chunky salsa. The recipe is excellent!
Fantastically delicious. Use the diced tomato with green chiles. It makes a difference. I added fresh chiles because I could not find the diced with chiles in a can.
this was great!!! I used it to stuff zucchini boats and added cheese. delish~
I substituted Chicken Stock for the water. It was outstanding. I'm pretty sure it would have been very good with the water, but we all love to tinker.
Substituting the water for chicken broth truly makes the flavor. I added other dry hot peppers to give it some heat. I have never made rice like this and my family raved about it.
Loved this!
It was ok. I would have liked a bit more flavor.
Love it...i used chicken stock instead of water, added minced garlic and had too add Hamburg but the family says no may no eat... Lol
Made this for the guys at the firehouse, quadrupled the batch and added 5 minced jalapenos... They absolutely loved it.
This was an great recipe. I didn't have have peppers or canned tomatoes so I used salsa instead. I also used chicken broth instead of water. Tasted great.
Made as directed and it was okay. Lacking a little something but it is a good base and a great way to cook rice.
It was delicious and very easy to make. I ended up having quite a bit left over so added beans and chicken and made a burrito bowl the next day!
it was a bit bland. I did use chicken stock instead of water. Next time I will follow other reviewer's advice and add cumin.

Was really good. Next time I will follow some of the other reviews and use chicken broth instead of water, and likely add a little cumin. However, I made it as written for a group to go with chicken tacos. Got several compliments.

I made this today, and followed Jodi Lynn's adjustments about adding cumin and making it with chicken broth. I DID end up needing about 1/2 - 3/4 cup water, but it tastes absolutely amazing! Thank you so much for this amazing recipe =)
I made this recipe exactly how it originally was but with less bell pepper. It tastes amazing and I would definently make it again! I added it to tacos, too!
very good! I cut down on the salt because I thought it might be too much with the canned tomatoes, but I wish I hadn't. Don't change a thing

Super easy to make and delicious. I work late nights at a grocery store and grab these simple ingredients on my way out. It simmers while I'm in the shower, and it's ready by the time I start up my Xbox.
Easy and tasty! :)
Too much onion! Will make again but with less onion, good recipe.

Made this tonight, what a great easy recipe! I sticked to the recipe pretty much only changes that I made was that I used chicken stock instead of water and added garlic, jalapeno , and whatever veggies I had in fridge. Dash of cumin and Mexican oregano. The rice cooks up well. I served it with baked tilapia and corn tortillas. Yum!
I do 1 cup of broth and 1 cup water for additional flavoring.
Followed recipe exactly and it was exceptional! My daughter is vegan, and it was perfect for her, but not lacking in anything for a non vegan. Loved it!

I use 1 cup of water and one cup of broth for a little more flavor. Also. this steams quickly on my electric stove in a deep skillet, adding a little more water seems to steam the dish more evenly. I think I may add a little cumin next time also.

I was looking for an easy Spanish Rice to add to my enchilada's.This was perfect. I exchanged the green bell peppers for 1/2 orange and red bell peppers and added some green chilis and garlic for flavor and color. I used vegetable broth instead of water with a bit of Spanish seasoning zest. Hmm, hmm, good! It came out wonderful.
Will definitely make it again. Followed the recipe to a tee, just added a bit of hot sauce to boot it up a little. Went great with the touch of chili powder.
This was a really easy dish to make and the results were great. I did add beans to make the two side dishes into one, very happy.

This is almost like my Mom made in NE NM where I grew up. I almost make it the same. The main difference is I brown the rice in olive oil until it just starts to turn brown. I add the rice to the rest after they began simmering. The other ingredients I've mixed and matched over time, but this is a great basic Spanish rice.
Good rice. Served with poblano peppers.
Even the next day left overs are great!

Liked very much as a side dish or a one-dish meal with pork chops. EASY TO MAKE.
The pork chops were browned in skillet and then set aside while following recipe for the rice [used same skillet for rice). Also used only half of chili powder. 
Pork chops added back into rice to simmer till done.
Made this for the first time, a few weeks ago-the first time ever making Spanish rice. And it was a SUPER success.
This was so easy.... and without instant rice. I added small shrimp to make it a meal in a dish. Next time I'll add slice black olives.
I cooked this recipe as directed. Flavor was good but the rice was dry. I will add more broth to the next batch.
This is very good. I browned a pound of lean beef after I made this like the recipe said and then mixed in the beef. It was delish!!!
Turned out really good. Too spicy for my family, I'll half the chili powder next time. I used chicken broth after reading other reviews and added garlic but 4 stars because it was on the mushy side.
I used chicken stock instead of water, 1 tsp of chili powder and 1/2 tsp cumin. It tasted great. This recipe is good only for 3-4 people.

Very good. I even used instant rice instead of regular long grain. Worked great. Just be sure you have "an eye for an eye" of liquid to rice ratio. I mention this as I increased the amount to 2 cups rice and I used 2 cups chicken broth (made with bouillon cubes) instead of water. Otherwise, exactly the same. DELICIOUS!

I love Spanish rice, but not my husband. However, he really enjoyed this recipe. He asked me to make it again! I changed one ingredient. I substituted a cubanelle pepper, also known as Cuban pepper, for the green pepper. That's what I had on hand. I will definitely make this recipe again! Goodbye store-bought Spanish rice!
No I did not , and yes I will make it again. Thanks for the recipe.

Been using this recipe for a reference for a while now! I made some changes others suggested. I used low sodium chicken broth instead of water, used 1/4 cup of tomato sauce instead diced tomatoes and green chilies (turns out less soggy), added some minced garlic, added 1 tsp or less of cumin, and a dash of cayenne for extra spice. I sometimes use a few dashes of onion powder or garlic powder and chop up a bit of jalapeno to throw in with the onions and rice. Yum!
